data.title: Issue with String.localeCompare in Atom Helper
data.body:
I am writing a plugin that uses `vinyl-fs`, one of it's node modules uses `String.localeCompare`.  In the new version of atom I am having an issues with this function that does not exist in my local version of node 0.11.14

``` bash
~/g/atom-typescript-tools: /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom\ Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom\ Helper
> process.version
'v0.11.14'
> 'asdf'.localeCompare('sd')
fish: Job 1, '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom\ Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom\ Helper' terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)
drwxr-xr-x jonathanpark:staff typescript-1.4-update âœ—
~/g/atom-typescript-tools: node
> process.version
'v0.11.14'
> 'asdf'.localeCompare('sd')
-18
```

As you can see if I open Atom Helper as a node process, run the localeCompare test and it throws a segmentation fault.  In my local node 0.11.14 install it works fine.   I suspect that there is an issue where the localeCompare code utilizes some system library that isn't compiled correctly for my os version.  I am running OSX 10.10 and have not updated to 10.10.1 and the new command line tools yet.

data.title: Open Settings View is now empty
data.body:
I have uninstalled and reinstalled atom. Settings view has been working. 

I was helping to debug a save-session bug (Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function (#34)) and was attempting to disable save session package when the contents of open settings view became empty (atom/config).

Any suggestions on how to restore the atom/config?

data.title: Auto-indent misbehaving inside a script handlebar template tag
data.body:
**Issue:**
When writing HTML inside an Handlebar template tag, the auto-indent doesn't work

**To reproduce:**
- Write the `script` tag and open a `div` tag

``` html
<script type="text/x-handlebars-template">
  <div>
</script>
```
- Insert a new line

Expected result:

``` html
<script type="text/x-handlebars-template">
  <div>
    The line is indented here
</script>
```

**Actual** result:

``` html
<script type="text/x-handlebars-template">
  <div>
  The line is indented here
</script>
```

data.title: Renderer process hogs CPU after opening and closing settings tab
data.body:
1. Open a new instance of Atom.
2. Check the CPU usage of all Atom processes. They should be close to 0%, with occasional spikes.
3. Open the settings tab (Ctrl+,), then immediately close it. Repeat this step 20 times.
4. Check the CPU usage of all Atom processes. The renderer process (`atom.exe --type=renderer ...`) will now be constantly consuming CPU time (~12% on my quad-core PC).

If you repeat step 3 enough times, eventually the renderer process will consume 100% CPU time on a single core, and Atom becomes very unresponsive.

This is on Windows 7 after a fresh install of Atom. The only settings I have changed are to set the theme to Atom Light/Base16 Tomorrow Dark.

I took some profile measurements using the Developer Tools. After performing the above steps, Atom is spending 86Ã— more CPU time in `React.createClass.toggleCursorBlink` and 61Ã— more CPU time in `React.createClass.pollDOM`. I guess that Atom is failing to clean up some `setInterval`s, or similar.

I wanted to attach profile measurements, but the â€˜saveâ€™ button in the profiler just saves an empty file.

data.title: Outdent not always complementary to indent
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Configure soft tabs, tab width two spaces.
2. Enter a line of text.
3. Indent line twice (such that it has 4 leading spaces).
4. Dedent line once.

Expected result: Line is at first indent level. (2 leading spaces.)
Actual result: Line is at zero-th indent level. (No leading spaces.)

data.title: Pass safeMode and devMode load settings to new windows
data.body:
Previously, when you opened a new window from safeMode or devMode, the mode settings were not persisted. This has always annoyed me. Now, when you open windows from safe mode, they are also safe mode windows, and if you open dev mode windows from a dev mode window, they are dev mode windows.

Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4690

data.title: New windows are not maximized
data.body:
<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>N</kbd> opens up a new, _non-maximized_ window on Windows.  This results in some graphical issues as described in #2936.
However, opening up a folder (which opens up a new window after the first time, which is a different bug-#3406) using <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>O</kbd> or Open in Atom works fine.

Windows 7 x64, Atom 0.162.0.

data.title: Add Downloading Update progress
data.body: Basicly what the title says, I don't know how much it downloaded now because it has no progress indicator but I've had atom open for over 30minutes now and the update has not finished downloading. That seems wrong.
